description: From Latin praescriptivus (“relating to a legal exception”), from praescript- (“directed in writing”), from the verb praescribere.

adjectives.description: prescriptive (comparative more prescriptive, superlative most prescriptive)

entries.meaning: Of or pertaining to prescribing or enjoining, especially an action or behavior based on a norm or standard.
examples: Antonyms: (especially of grammar and usage) descriptive, proscriptive, nonprescriptive
